Description: Fragment of lid of Attic black-figured pottery pyxis, possibly of Nikosthenic type; interior: glazed black with one band in added red near centre of sherd; exterior: vertical chain of opposed palmettes between dilute bands; between palmettes, dilute brown 'tear drops' (some with tails) in outline; towards rim, one dilute band and a broader band with added red; ancient repair hole in upper right of sherd.
Curator's comments: The palmette chain might have divided a scene as seen on British Museum 1886,0401.1189.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 347-8, no. B432)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0824) (Phase 1)
